segments.text: Who was the best teacher that you ever had ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That would have to be Miss Baymler , my fourth grade teacher .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What was she like ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She was patient , kind , fun , smart , caring , and yet strict , too . I really learned a lot from her .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What kind of things did you learn ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She taught us that you can do anything that you want to do .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Anything ? Do you really believe that we can do anything ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If you really want to do something and you work hard at it , I believe you can do it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You said she was strict . Did she have a lot of rules ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: She had some rules that helped us to feel comfortable . For example , the students had to treat each other with respect , or they would be disciplined .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . She sounds like she really cared about her students .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . She treated us all fairly . She don ’ t have any teacher ’ s pets .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Really ? Doesn ’ t every teacher have a teacher ’ s pet ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well . To be honest , I usually sucked up to teachers because I wanted them to give me good grades . However , Miss Baymler didn ’ t treat me any differently . She really didn ’ t have any teacher ’ s pets .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you know what she is doing now ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: As a matter of fact , I do . After she taught our class , she got married and moved to another city . Then , she started writing children ’ s book .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Have you ever read one of the books ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Of course ! Both children and adults enjoy her books .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why don ’ t you recommend one to me ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: ok ! I ’ ll bring one to you next time .
segments.speaker: S2
